events.description: lead vehicle decelerates; The vehicle in front of ego-car decelerates or stops suddenly
events.justification: When the ego-car driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front vehicle, he should quickly decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the front vehicle.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle controls loss; The vehicle evades other vehicles, pedestrians or objects and changes lanes emergently; [SEP]
events.justification: The safety distance between the vehicle and the front vehicle should be sufficient for emergency braking. In case of an emergency on the road, the vehicles should stop in the lane and try not to change lanes in an emergency. If the braking distance is not enough, collision avoidance can be taken. The vehicles should turn on the turn signal and observe the rear vehicles and change lanes quickly.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns on a road with the same direction to another vehicle; Ego-car drives too fast and the braking distance is short; [SEP]
events.justification: Ego-cars should not exceed the speed limit during driving, slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, especially for areas with many pedestrians.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle overtakes; vehicles drive too fast with short braking distance; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicles should not exceed the speed limit during driving, especially in areas with many pedestrians.Vehicles should slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.description: lead vehicle stops; The vehicle in front of ego-car decelerates or stops suddenly
events.justification: When the ego-car driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front vehicle, he should quickly decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the front vehicle.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle  goes straight crossing paths at non-signalized junctions; vehicles drive too fast with short braking distance; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicles should not exceed the speed limit during driving, especially in areas with many pedestrians.Vehicles should slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.description: ego-car controls loss; Ego-car is out of control
events.justification: Ego-cars should not drive too fast in bad weather, such as rainy, snowy, nighttime, or in poor locations, such as mountain areas, curves, etc. At the same time, ego-car drivers should keep calm, control the vehicle well, use fast braking to slow down, and do not step on the brakes.

events.description: ego-car turns right across path at signalized junctions; vehicles do not give way to normal driving vehicles when turning or changing lanes
events.justification: Before turning or changing lanes, vehicles should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles and control the speed. When driving, vehicles should abide by traffic rules, and give the way for the normal running vehicles. Vehicles that will enter the main road should give way to the vehicles which drive on the main road or leave the main road. Vehicles that drive on the auxiliary road should give way to the vehicles which drive off the main road.

events.description: a vehicle turns right across path at non-signalized junctions; Ego-car drives too fast and the braking distance is short
events.justification: Ego-cars should not exceed the speed limit during driving, slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, especially for areas with many pedestrians.

events.description: lead vehicle stops; The vehicle in front of ego-car decelerates or stops suddenly
events.justification: When the ego-car driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front vehicle, he should quickly decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the front vehicle.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle retrogrades; The vehicle does not notice the vehicles when reversing; [SEP]
events.justification: Before reversing the vehicle, the vehicles should observe the surrounding environment, scan the three rear-view mirrors by turns, put the foot on the brake, and brake in time if necessary. Other vehicles should stay away from the reversing vehicles, pass or stop in time, and sound the horn when necessary.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle retrogrades; The vehicle does not notice the vehicles when reversing; [SEP]
events.justification: Before reversing the vehicle, the vehicles should observe the surrounding environment, scan the three rear-view mirrors by turns, put the foot on the brake, and brake in time if necessary. Other vehicles should stay away from the reversing vehicles, pass or stop in time, and sound the horn when necessary.

events.description: ego-car makes a dodge action; Ego-car is out of control
events.justification: Ego-cars should not drive too fast in bad weather, such as rainy, snowy, nighttime, or in poor locations, such as mountain areas, curves, etc. At the same time, ego-car drivers should keep calm, control the vehicle well, use fast braking to slow down, and do not step on the brakes.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle runs red light; vehicles run red light; [SEP]
events.justification: The vehicle drivers should strictly abide by the traffic rules during driving. When the red light is on, he/she shall brake in time. When he/she encounters a zebra crossing or stop line during driving, he/she must pay attention to the traffic lights.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle  goes straight crossing paths at non-signalized junctions; Motorcycle drives too fast with a short braking distance; [SEP]
events.justification: The motorcycle shall not exceed the speed limit during driving, and shall slow down when passing the intersection, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle controls loss; The truck brakes emergently; [SEP]
events.justification: The trucks should keep enough distance from the surrounding vehicles when driving. When braking, the trucks should slow down with quick braking, and do not step on the brake.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle  goes straight crossing paths at non-signalized junctions; vehicles run red light; [SEP]
events.justification: The vehicle drivers should strictly abide by the traffic rules during driving. When the red light is on, he/she shall brake in time. When he/she encounters a zebra crossing or stop line during driving, he/she must pay attention to the traffic lights.

events.description: [CLS]ego-car controls loss; Ego-car turns too fast; [SEP]
events.justification: When turning, reduce the speed of ego-car first, and then increase the turning radius of the vehicle to turn. Do not turn the steering wheel violently, especially for heavy vehicles, which are prone to sideslip

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns right across path at signalized junctions; vehicles do not give way to normal driving vehicles when turning or changing lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: Before turning or changing lanes, vehicles should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles and control the speed. events.justification: Vehicles should not drive too fast in bad weather and severe road types, such as rainy, snowy, nightyime, or in poor locations, and mountain areas and curves. events.description: [CLS]ego-car overtakes; Ego-car drives too fast in rainy and snowy day; [SEP]
events.justification: Ego-car must get off slowly in such bad weather as rainy, snowy and fogy, keep a large distance from the vehicle in front, keep driving at a low speed and at a constant speed, pay attention to pedestrians on the road and vehicles around, and try not to step on the brake pedal frequently and too hard.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car/another vehicle; vehicles do not notice the coming vehicles when turning or changling lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: If the vehicles turn on the turn signal in advance when changing lanes or turning, they should pay attention to the speed limit, and give way to the straightly moving vehicles.

events.justification: If the vehicles turn on the turn signal in advance when changing lanes or turning, they should pay attention to the speed limit, and give way to the straightly moving vehicles.

events.justification: The truck should keep a safe distance from the front vehicle for emergency braking. At the same time, it is safe enough not to hit the roadside car or drive out of the road.

events.justification: If the ego-cars turn on the turn signal in advance when turning, they should pay attention to the observation and control of the speed, and give way to the straight moving vehicles.

events.description: [CLS]there is an object crash; The ego-car's vision is blocked or blurred, and there is no time to brake; [SEP]
events.justification: Ego-cars should slow down or honk their horns when they stop at intersections or trunk roads where their vision is blocked to prevent other vehicles or pedestrians from rushing out suddenly.

events.description: a vehicle turns around at non-signalized junctions; Ego-car evades other vehicles, pedestrians or objects and changes lanes emergently
events.justification: The safety distances between the ego-car and the front vehicle should be sufficient for emergency braking. In case of an emergency on the road, the ego-car should stop in the lane and try not to change lanes in an emergency. If the braking distance is not enough, collision avoidance can be taken. Ego-car should turn on the turn signal and observe the rear vehicles, and change lanes quickly.

events.description: [CLS]lead vehicle stops; The vehicle ahead decelerates or stops suddenly; [SEP]
events.justification: When the front vehicles decelerate or stop suddenly, the driver should quickly follow and decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the vehicle in front.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car/another vehicle; vehicles drive too fast with short braking distance; [SEP]

events.justification: Ego-cars should try to avoid changing lanes at will, so as not to affect the normal traffic of the rear vehicles. They should always look at the rearview mirror and pay attention to the distance to the rear vehicles. For rear vehicles, when the braking light of the front vehicle lights up, they should brake synchronously, slow down, and keep a safe distance to the front vehicle.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle controls loss; The vehicle drives too fast in rainy and snowy day; [SEP]
events.justification: The vehicle must get off slowly in such bad weather as rainy, snowy and fogy, keep a large distance from the vehicle in front, keep driving at a low speed and at a constant speed, pay attention to pedestrians on the road and vehicles around, and try not to step on the brake pedal frequently and too hard.

events.description: [CLS]a following vehicle makes a maneuver; The vehicle ahead decelerates or stops suddenly; [SEP]
events.justification: When the front vehicles decelerate or stop suddenly, the driver should quickly follow and decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the vehicle in front.

events.description: lead vehicle decelerates; The vehicle in front of ego-car decelerates or stops suddenly
events.justification: When the ego-car driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front vehicle, he should quickly decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the front vehicle.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car/another vehicle; the truck does not notice the coming vehicles when turning or changling lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: If the trucks turn on the turn signal in advance when turning or turning, they should pay attention to the speed limit, and give way to the straightly moving vehicles.

events.description: a vehicle goes straight near the center line of the road; The vehicle in front of ego-car decelerates or stops suddenly
events.justification: When the ego-car driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front vehicle, he should quickly decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the front vehicle.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle  goes straight at signalized junctions; vehicles drive too fast with short braking distance; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicles should not exceed the speed limit during driving, especially in areas with many pedestrians.Vehicles should slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.description: ego-car turns right across path at non-signalized junctions; Ego-car driver fail to estimate the accurate distance when turning
events.justification: Ego-car drivers should practice turning more, slow down when turning, and keep a safe distance from other vehicles.

events.description: a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car; vehicles do not notice the coming vehicles when turning or changling lanes
events.justification: If the vehicles turn on the turn signal in advance when changing lanes or turning, they should pay attention to the speed limit, and give way to the straightly moving vehicles.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle makes an evasive action; vehicles are out of control; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicles should not drive too fast in bad weather and severe road types, such as rainy, snowy, nightyime, or in poor locations, and mountain areas and curves. At the same time, vehicle drivers should keep calm, control the vehicle, and slow down with quick braking. Do not step on the brakes.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle makes an evasive action; vehicles do not give way to normal driving vehicles when turning or changing lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: Before turning or changing lanes, vehicles should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles and control the speed. Vehicles that will enter the main road should give way to the vehicles which drive on the main road or leave the main road. Vehicles that drive on the auxiliary road should give way to the vehicles which drive off the main road.

events.justification: Before driving, ego-car must be carefully checked, and the articles carried on the vehicle must be bundled. During driving, the goods must also be observed at any time. If there is looseness, inclination and other conditions, they should be timely re wrapped and bundled; During driving, the self-propelled vehicle should keep a certain safe distance from other vehicles, especially for the large trucks carrying goods, and should not follow or parallel with them for a long time.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle  goes straight crossing paths at non-signalized junctions; vehicles's vision are blocked and there is no time to brake; [SEP]
events.justification: When the vehicle stops at the intersection or trunk road where the vision is blocked, the vehicle should slow down or whistle to prevent other vehicles or pedestrians from rushing out suddenly.

events.description: ego-car overtakes; vehicles do not notice the coming vehicles when turning or changling lanes
events.justification: If the vehicles turn on the turn signal in advance when changing lanes or turning, they should pay attention to the speed limit, and give way to the straightly moving vehicles.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle overtakes; The vehicle overtakes without giving the way to the normal running vehicle; [SEP]
events.justification: When overtaking, the vehicle should observe the driving conditions of other lanes, so as not to interfere with the driving of vehicles in other lanes, and do not force overtaking without overtaking conditions.

events.description: [CLS]a cyclist changes lines into motorway; Cyclist does not notice the coming vehicles when crossing the road; [SEP]
events.justification: Cyclists should cross the road at the crosswaly, and do not cross the road in a hurry. Cyclists should pay attention to the coming vehicles; Drivers should slow down and give way when they encounter cyclists crossing the road.

events.description: vehicles meet on the road; Ego-car does not give the way at narrow road
events.justification: Ego-cars should give way at the obstacle road section, narrow mountain road and other places, park at a place with enough width to meet, let the other party pass first, pay attention to the left and right rear-view mirrors, and try to ensure that their right wheels are on the right side of the road.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle retrogrades; The vehicle does not notice the vehicles when reversing; [SEP]
events.justification: Before reversing the vehicle, the vehicles should observe the surrounding environment, scan the three rear-view mirrors by turns, put the foot on the brake, and brake in time if necessary. Other vehicles should stay away from the reversing vehicles, pass or stop in time, and sound the horn when necessary.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle controls loss; The vehicle evades other vehicles, pedestrians or objects and changes lanes emergently; [SEP]
events.justification: The safety distance between the vehicle and the front vehicle should be sufficient for emergency braking. In case of an emergency on the road, the vehicles should stop in the lane and try not to change lanes in an emergency. If the braking distance is not enough, collision avoidance can be taken. The vehicles should turn on the turn signal and observe the rear vehicles and change lanes quickly.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle backes up into another vehicle; The vehicle does not notice the vehicles when reversing; [SEP]
events.justification: Before reversing the vehicle, the vehicles should observe the surrounding environment, scan the three rear-view mirrors by turns, put the foot on the brake, and brake in time if necessary. Other vehicles should stay away from the reversing vehicles, pass or stop in time, and sound the horn when necessary.

events.description: a vehicle turns on a road with the same direction to ego-car; vehicles do not notice the coming vehicles when turning or changling lanes
events.justification: If the vehicles turn on the turn signal in advance when changing lanes or turning, they should pay attention to the speed limit, and give way to the straightly moving vehicles.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns on a road with the same direction to another vehicle; vehicles do not give way to normal driving vehicles when turning or changing lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: Before turning or changing lanes, vehicles should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles and control the speed. When driving, vehicles should abide by traffic rules, and give the way for the normal running vehicles. Vehicles that will enter the main road should give way to the vehicles which drive on the main road or leave the main road. Vehicles that drive on the auxiliary road should give way to the vehicles which drive off the main road.

At the same time, vehicle drivers should keep calm, control the vehicle, and slow down with quick braking. Do not step on the brakes.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns on a road with the same direction to ego-car; vehicles do not give way to normal driving vehicles when turning or changing lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: Before turning or changing lanes, vehicles should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles and control the speed. When driving, vehicles should abide by traffic rules, and give the way for the normal running vehicles. Vehicles that will enter the main road should give way to the vehicles which drive on the main road or leave the main road. Vehicles that drive on the auxiliary road should give way to the vehicles which drive off the main road.

events.description: [CLS]ego-car changes lanes with the same direction to another vehicle; Ego-car does not notice the vehicle when turning or changing lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: If the ego-cars turn on the turn signal in advance when turning, they should pay attention to the observation and control of the speed, and give way to the straight moving vehicles.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle  goes straight crossing paths at non-signalized junctions; vehicles run red light; [SEP]
events.justification: The vehicle drivers should strictly abide by the traffic rules during driving. When the red light is on, he/she shall brake in time. When he/she encounters a zebra crossing or stop line during driving, he/she must pay attention to the traffic lights.

events.justification: Vehicles should not exceed the speed limit during driving, especially in areas with many pedestrians.Vehicles should slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle makes an evasive action; The vehicle driver is in distracted driving; [SEP]
events.justification: The vehicle drivers should not answer or make calls while riding, eat or smoke while riding, sleep, and drive in fatigue.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns on a road with the same direction to another vehicle; vehicles drive too fast with short braking distance; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicles should not exceed the speed limit during driving, especially in areas with many pedestrians.Vehicles should slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car/another vehicle; Ego-car is rear ended by the rear car; [SEP]
events.justification: Ego-cars should try to avoid changing lanes at will, so as not to affect the normal traffic of the rear vehicles. They should always look at the rearview mirror and pay attention to the distance to the rear vehicles. For rear vehicles, when the braking light of the front vehicle lights up, they should brake synchronously, slow down, and keep a safe distance to the front vehicle.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car/another vehicle; vehicles do not notice the coming vehicles when turning or changling lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: If the vehicles turn on the turn signal in advance when changing lanes or turning, they should pay attention to the speed limit, and give way to the straightly moving vehicles.

events.description: a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car; Ego-car evades other vehicles, pedestrians or objects and changes lanes emergently
events.justification: The safety distances between the ego-car and the front vehicle should be sufficient for emergency braking. In case of an emergency on the road, the ego-car should stop in the lane and try not to change lanes in an emergency. If the braking distance is not enough, collision avoidance can be taken. Ego-car should turn on the turn signal and observe the rear vehicles, and change lanes quickly.

events.justification: The vehicle must get off slowly in such bad weather as rainy, snowy and fogy, keep a large distance from the vehicle in front, keep driving at a low speed and at a constant speed, pay attention to pedestrians on the road and vehicles around, and try not to step on the brake pedal frequently and too hard.

events.description: lead vehicle stops; The vehicle does not notice the vehicles when reversing

events.description: [CLS]a pedestrian crosses the road; Pedestrian does not notice the coming vehicles when crossing the street.; [SEP]
events.justification: When passing the zebra crossing, drivers must slow down. At the same time, vehicle drivers should keep calm, control the vehicle, and slow down with quick braking. Do not step on the brakes.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle overtakes; The vehicle overtakes without giving the way to the normal running vehicle; [SEP]
events.justification: When overtaking, the vehicle should observe the driving conditions of other lanes, so as not to interfere with the driving of vehicles in other lanes, and do not force overtaking without overtaking conditions.

events.description: [CLS]lead vehicle stops; The vehicle in front of ego-car decelerates or stops suddenly; [SEP]
events.justification: When the ego-car driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front vehicle, he should quickly decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the front vehicle.

events.description: a vehicle turns left across path at signalized junctions; Ego-car drives too fast and the braking distance is short
events.justification: Ego-cars should not exceed the speed limit during driving, slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, especially for areas with many pedestrians.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car/another vehicle; vehicles do not give way to normal driving vehicles when turning or changing lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: Before turning or changing lanes, vehicles should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles and control the speed. When driving, vehicles should abide by traffic rules, and give the way for the normal running vehicles. Vehicles that will enter the main road should give way to the vehicles which drive on the main road or leave the main road. Vehicles that drive on the auxiliary road should give way to the vehicles which drive off the main road.

events.description: [CLS]a motorbike crosses the road; Motorcycle runs the red light; [SEP]
events.justification: When riding a motorcycle, you must wear a safety helmet correctly in moving. Do not run through red lights. Stop retrogradation.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car/another vehicle; vehicles do not notice the coming vehicles when turning or changling lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: If the vehicles turn on the turn signal in advance when changing lanes or turning, they should pay attention to the speed limit, and give way to the straightly moving vehicles.

events.description: ego-car turns right across path at non-signalized junctions; Ego-car does not notice the vehicle when turning or changing lanes
events.justification: If the ego-cars turn on the turn signal in advance when turning, they should pay attention to the observation and control of the speed, and give way to the straight moving vehicles.

events.description: [CLS]lead vehicle decelerates; The vehicle in front of ego-car decelerates or stops suddenly; [SEP]
events.justification: When the ego-car driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front vehicle, he should quickly decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the front vehicle.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns on a road with the same direction to ego-car; Ego-car turns or changes lanes without giving way to normal vehicles in the lane; [SEP]
events.justification: Before turning or changing lanes, ego-cars should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles and control their speed; When driving, they should give way to normal driving vehicles. The vehicles that will enter the main road should give way to those that run on the main road and those that leave the main road; The vehicles that run on the auxiliary road should give way to those that run off the main road.

events.description: a following vehicle makes a maneuver; Ego-car is rear ended by the rear car
events.justification: Ego-cars should try to avoid changing lanes at will, so as not to affect the normal traffic of the rear vehicles. They should always look at the rearview mirror and pay attention to the distance to the rear vehicles. For rear vehicles, when the braking light of the front vehicle lights up, they should brake synchronously, slow down, and keep a safe distance to the front vehicle.

events.justification: Vehicles should slow down when crossing the non-signalized intersection, and observe coming vehicles carefully.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle runs red light; vehicles run red light; [SEP]

events.description: [CLS]lead vehicle stops; The vehicle evades other vehicles, pedestrians or objects and changes lanes emergently; [SEP]

The vehicles should turn on the turn signal and observe the rear vehicles and change lanes quickly.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle overtakes; The vehicle overtakes without giving the way to the normal running vehicle; [SEP]
events.justification: When overtaking, the vehicle should observe the driving conditions of other lanes, so as not to interfere with the driving of vehicles in other lanes, and do not force overtaking without overtaking conditions.

events.description: [CLS]lead vehicle stops; The vehicle in front of ego-car decelerates or stops suddenly; [SEP]
events.justification: When the ego-car driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front vehicle, he should quickly decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the front vehicle.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns left across path at non-signalized junctions; vehicles do not notice the coming vehicles when turning or changling lanes; [SEP]

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle  goes straight at signalized junctions; vehicles run red light; [SEP]

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns left across path at non-signalized junctions; The truck height exceeds the height limit; [SEP]

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle controls loss; Ego-car turns too fast; [SEP]

events.description: vehicles meet on the road; The truck ahead decelerates or stops suddenly
events.justification: When the truck driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front car, it should follow the deceleration quickly and observe the road conditions. The truck driver should put his foot on the brake pedal and be ready to step on the brake at any time. A sufficient safety distance should be left from the car in front.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car/another vehicle; vehicles do not give way to normal driving vehicles when turning or changing lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: Before turning or changing lanes, vehicles should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles and control the speed. When driving, vehicles should abide by traffic rules, and give the way for the normal running vehicles. Vehicles that will enter the main road should give way to the vehicles which drive on the main road or leave the main road. Vehicles that drive on the auxiliary road should give way to the vehicles which drive off the main road.

events.description: [CLS]lead vehicle stops; vehicles drive too fast with short braking distance; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicles should not exceed the speed limit during driving, especially in areas with many pedestrians.Vehicles should slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.description: a vehicle turns on a road with the opposite direction to ego-car; vehicles are out of control
events.justification: Vehicles should not drive too fast in bad weather and severe road types, such as rainy, snowy, nightyime, or in poor locations, and mountain areas and curves. At the same time, vehicle drivers should keep calm, control the vehicle, and slow down with quick braking. Do not step on the brakes.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns on a road with the same direction to ego-car; vehicles do not give way to normal driving vehicles when turning or changing lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: Before turning or changing lanes, vehicles should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles and control the speed. events.description: [CLS]a vehicle makes an evasive action; The vehicle driver does not estimate the accurate distance when turning; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicle drivers should practice turning more times, slow down when turning, and keep a safe distance from other vehicles.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle overtakes; The vehicle overtakes without giving the way to the normal running vehicle; [SEP]
events.justification: When overtaking, the vehicle should observe the driving conditions of other lanes, so as not to interfere with the driving of vehicles in other lanes, and do not force overtaking without overtaking conditions.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns on a road with the same direction to another vehicle; vehicles do not notice the coming vehicles when turning or changling lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: If the vehicles turn on the turn signal in advance when changing lanes or turning, they should pay attention to the speed limit, and give way to the straightly moving vehicles.

events.description: a motorbike left turn across path at non-signalized junctions; Motorcycle drives too fast with a short braking distance; [SEP]
events.justification: The motorcycle shall not exceed the speed limit during driving, and shall slow down when passing the intersection, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.description: [CLS]there is an object crash; truck tires fall off when driving; [SEP]
events.justification: Before driving, the truck driver should visually check whether the bolts and nuts of the wheels are complete, rusty, cracked or damaged. When driving, if the tires fall off, the truck driver should hold the steering wheel tightly, slow down after observing the rear vehicle through the rearview mirror, and turn on the hazard warning flash.

events.description: [CLS]ego-car turns left across path at non-signalized junctions; Ego-car turns or changes lanes without giving way to normal vehicles in the lane; [SEP]
events.justification: Before turning or changing lanes, ego-cars should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles and control their speed; When driving, they should give way to normal driving vehicles. The vehicles that will enter the main road should give way to those that run on the main road and those that leave the main road; The vehicles that run on the auxiliary road should give way to those that run off the main road.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car/another vehicle; The vehicle driver does not estimate the accurate distance when turning; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicle drivers should practice turning more times, slow down when turning, and keep a safe distance from other vehicles.

events.description: [CLS]an vehicle turns around at non-signalized junctions; vehicles drive too fast with short braking distance; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicles should not exceed the speed limit during driving, especially in areas with many pedestrians.Vehicles should slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.justification: Vehicles should not exceed the speed limit during driving, especially in areas with many pedestrians.Vehicles should slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.description: [CLS]lead vehicle stops; Ego-car evades other vehicles, pedestrians or objects and changes lanes emergently; [SEP]
events.justification: The safety distances between the ego-car and the front vehicle should be sufficient for emergency braking. In case of an emergency on the road, the ego-car should stop in the lane and try not to change lanes in an emergency. If the braking distance is not enough, collision avoidance can be taken. Ego-car should turn on the turn signal and observe the rear vehicles, and change lanes quickly.

events.description: [CLS]a following vehicle makes a maneuver; The vehicle driver is in distracted driving; [SEP]
events.justification: The vehicle drivers should not answer or make calls while riding, eat or smoke while riding, sleep, and drive in fatigue.

events.description: [CLS]lead vehicle stops; vehicles's vision are blocked and there is no time to brake; [SEP]
events.justification: When the vehicle stops at the intersection or trunk road where the vision is blocked, the vehicle should slow down or whistle to prevent other vehicles or pedestrians from rushing out suddenly.

events.description: ego-car controls loss; Ego-car is out of control
events.justification: Ego-cars should not drive too fast in bad weather, such as rainy, snowy, nighttime, or in poor locations, such as mountain areas, curves, etc. At the same time, ego-car drivers should keep calm, control the vehicle well, use fast braking to slow down, and do not step on the brakes.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle accelerating to turn on a road; The vehicle turns too fast; [SEP]
events.justification: When turning, reduce the speed of the vehicle first, and then increase the turning radius of the vehicle to turn. Do not turn the steering wheel violently, especially for heavy vehicles, which are prone to sideslip

They should always look at the rearview mirror and pay attention to the distance to the rear vehicles. events.description: [CLS]ego-car  goes straight crossing paths at non-signalized junctions; vehicles drive too fast with short braking distance; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicles should not exceed the speed limit during driving, especially in areas with many pedestrians.Vehicles should slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.description: [CLS]a following vehicle makes a maneuver; Ego-car is rear ended by the rear car; [SEP]
events.justification: Ego-cars should try to avoid changing lanes at will, so as not to affect the normal traffic of the rear vehicles. They should always look at the rearview mirror and pay attention to the distance to the rear vehicles. For rear vehicles, when the braking light of the front vehicle lights up, they should brake synchronously, slow down, and keep a safe distance to the front vehicle.

events.description: [CLS]there is an object crash; The vehicle driver is in distracted driving; [SEP]
events.justification: The vehicle drivers should not answer or make calls while riding, eat or smoke while riding, sleep, and drive in fatigue.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle controls loss; The vehicle drives too fast in rainy and snowy day; [SEP]
events.justification: The vehicle must get off slowly in such bad weather as rainy, snowy and fogy, keep a large distance from the vehicle in front, keep driving at a low speed and at a constant speed, pay attention to pedestrians on the road and vehicles around, and try not to step on the brake pedal frequently and too hard.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle controls loss; The vehicle driver is in distracted driving; [SEP]
events.justification: The vehicle drivers should not answer or make calls while riding, eat or smoke while riding, sleep, and drive in fatigue.

events.description: a vehicle overtakes; The vehicle overtakes without giving the way to the normal running vehicle
events.justification: When overtaking, the vehicle should observe the driving conditions of other lanes, so as not to interfere with the driving of vehicles in other lanes, and do not force overtaking without overtaking conditions.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns left across path at non-signalized junctions; the truck does not notice the coming vehicles when turning or changling lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: If the trucks turn on the turn signal in advance when turning or turning, they should pay attention to the speed limit, and give way to the straightly moving vehicles.

events.description: [CLS]a pedestrian crosses the road; Motorcycle drives too fast with a short braking distance; [SEP]
events.justification: The motorcycle shall not exceed the speed limit during driving, and shall slow down when passing the intersection, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car/another vehicle; vehicles do not give way to normal driving vehicles when turning or changing lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: Before turning or changing lanes, vehicles should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles and control the speed. When driving, vehicles should abide by traffic rules, and give the way for the normal running vehicles. Vehicles that will enter the main road should give way to the vehicles which drive on the main road or leave the main road. Vehicles that drive on the auxiliary road should give way to the vehicles which drive off the main road.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle controls loss; The vehicle drives too fast with overspeed; [SEP]
events.justification: The vehicle should comply with the traffic rules during driving, and should not exceed the speed limit and load limit.

events.description: [CLS]a pedestrian crosses the road; vehicles do not notice the pedestrians when turning or changling lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: The speed of vehicles should not be too fast when changing lanes or turning. They should observe the coming vehicles and pedestrians carefully.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car/another vehicle; The vehicle in front of ego-car decelerates or stops suddenly; [SEP]
events.justification: When the ego-car driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front vehicle, he should quickly decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the front vehicle.

events.description: [CLS]ego-car changes lanes; The ego-car's vision is blocked or blurred, and there is no time to brake; [SEP]
events.justification: Ego-cars should slow down or honk their horns when they stop at intersections or trunk roads where their vision is blocked to prevent other vehicles or pedestrians from rushing out suddenly.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car/another vehicle; vehicles do not notice the motorcycles when turning or changling lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: If the vehicles turn on the turn signal in advance when changing lanes or turning, they should pay attention to the speed limit, and give way to the straightly moving motorcycle.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle  goes straight crossing paths at signalized junctions; Motorcycle does not notice the other vehicles when turning or changing lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: When changing lanes or turning, the motorcycle should observe the coming vehicles carefully, and turn on the turn signal in advance when changing lanes; The driver of the vehicle should increase the following distance, so that the motorcycle has enough time to react when turning or changing lanes.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle overtakes; The vehicle overtakes when turning; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicles should not overtake at narrow bridges, curves, steep slopes, tunnels, crosswalks and other places that do not meet the conditions for overtaking, and shall keep a safe distance from the vehicle ahead for emergency braking.

events.description: [CLS]lead vehicle stops; Ego-car driver is in distracted driving; [SEP]
events.justification: Ego-car drivers should not answer or make phone calls, eat or smoke while riding, sleep, and drive in fatigue.

events.description: [CLS]there is an object crash; vehicle tires fall off when driving; [SEP]
events.justification: Before driving, the driver should visually check whether the bolts and nuts of the wheels are complete, rusty, cracked or damaged. When driving, if the tires fall off, the drivers should hold the steering wheel tightly, slow down after observing the rear-vehicle through the rearview mirror, and turn on the hazard warning flash.

events.description: ego-car  goes straight crossing paths at non-signalized junctions; The ego-car's vision is blocked or blurred, and there is no time to brake
events.justification: Ego-cars should slow down or honk their horns when they stop at intersections or trunk roads where their vision is blocked to prevent other vehicles or pedestrians from rushing out suddenly.

events.description: ego-car controls loss; Ego-car evades other vehicles, pedestrians or objects and changes lanes emergently
events.justification: The safety distances between the ego-car and the front vehicle should be sufficient for emergency braking. In case of an emergency on the road, the ego-car should stop in the lane and try not to change lanes in an emergency. If the braking distance is not enough, collision avoidance can be taken. Ego-car should turn on the turn signal and observe the rear vehicles, and change lanes quickly.

events.description: [CLS]a cyclist runs red light; Cyclist runs the red light; [SEP]
events.justification: Cyclists should strictly abide by the traffic rules. When the red light is on, they should brake in time; The driver of the vehicle shall slow down in front of the traffic lights, so as to avoid collision with the bicycle that suddenly emerges.

events.justification: The vehicle drivers should not answer or make calls while riding, eat or smoke while riding, sleep, and drive in fatigue.

events.justification: If the vehicles turn on the turn signal in advance when changing lanes or turning, they should pay attention to the speed limit, and give way to the straightly moving vehicles.

events.justification: When the ego-car driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front vehicle, he should quickly decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the front vehicle.

events.description: a vehicle controls loss; vehicles are out of control
events.justification: Vehicles should not drive too fast in bad weather and severe road types, such as rainy, snowy, nightyime, or in poor locations, and mountain areas and curves. At the same time, vehicle drivers should keep calm, control the vehicle, and slow down with quick braking. Do not step on the brakes.

events.justification: The driver should practice emergency braking in more times. First release the accelerator, straighten the body, brake first, then brake, and then brake in front. Cooperate with the engine to brake. Don't stop for a moment. Let the wheels rotate slightly. When driving at high speed, you must not pinch the clutch.

events.description: [CLS]lead vehicle stops; The vehicle in front of ego-car decelerates or stops suddenly; [SEP]
events.justification: When the ego-car driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front vehicle, he should quickly decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the front vehicle.

events.justification: Vehicles should not exceed the speed limit during driving, especially in areas with many pedestrians.Vehicles should slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.description: a vehicle overtakes; The vehicle overtakes when turning
events.justification: Vehicles should not overtake at narrow bridges, curves, steep slopes, tunnels, crosswalks and other places that do not meet the conditions for overtaking, and shall keep a safe distance from the vehicle ahead for emergency braking.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle controls loss; vehicles are out of control; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicles should not drive too fast in bad weather and severe road types, such as rainy, snowy, nightyime, or in poor locations, and mountain areas and curves. At the same time, vehicle drivers should keep calm, control the vehicle, and slow down with quick braking. Do not step on the brakes.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle makes an evasive action; vehicles do not give way to normal driving vehicles when turning or changing lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: Before turning or changing lanes, vehicles should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles and control the speed. When driving, vehicles should abide by traffic rules, and give the way for the normal running vehicles. Vehicles that will enter the main road should give way to the vehicles which drive on the main road or leave the main road. Vehicles that drive on the auxiliary road should give way to the vehicles which drive off the main road.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle controls loss; The vehicle evades other vehicles, pedestrians or objects and changes lanes emergently; [SEP]
events.justification: The safety distance between the vehicle and the front vehicle should be sufficient for emergency braking. In case of an emergency on the road, the vehicles should stop in the lane and try not to change lanes in an emergency. If the braking distance is not enough, collision avoidance can be taken. The vehicles should turn on the turn signal and observe the rear vehicles and change lanes quickly.

events.justification: When the vehicle stops at the intersection or trunk road where the vision is blocked, the vehicle should slow down or whistle to prevent other vehicles or pedestrians from rushing out suddenly.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle overtakes; Ego-car is rear ended by the rear car; [SEP]
events.justification: Ego-cars should try to avoid changing lanes at will, so as not to affect the normal traffic of the rear vehicles. They should always look at the rearview mirror and pay attention to the distance to the rear vehicles. For rear vehicles, when the braking light of the front vehicle lights up, they should brake synchronously, slow down, and keep a safe distance to the front vehicle.

events.description: ego-car turns left across path at non-signalized junctions; Ego-car drives too fast and the braking distance is short
events.justification: Ego-cars should not exceed the speed limit during driving, slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, especially for areas with many pedestrians.

events.description: a vehicle backes up into another vehicle; The vehicle does not notice the vehicles when reversing
events.justification: Before reversing the vehicle, the vehicles should observe the surrounding environment, scan the three rear-view mirrors by turns, put the foot on the brake, and brake in time if necessary. Other vehicles should stay away from the reversing vehicles, pass or stop in time, and sound the horn when necessary.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle overtakes; The vehicle overtakes when turning; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicles should not overtake at narrow bridges, curves, steep slopes, tunnels, crosswalks and other places that do not meet the conditions for overtaking, and shall keep a safe distance from the vehicle ahead for emergency braking.

events.description: [CLS]there is an object crash; vehicles are out of control; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicles should not drive too fast in bad weather and severe road types, such as rainy, snowy, nightyime, or in poor locations, and mountain areas and curves. At the same time, vehicle drivers should keep calm, control the vehicle, and slow down with quick braking. Do not step on the brakes.

events.description: there is an object crash; Ego-car evades other vehicles, pedestrians or objects and changes lanes emergently
events.justification: The safety distances between the ego-car and the front vehicle should be sufficient for emergency braking. In case of an emergency on the road, the ego-car should stop in the lane and try not to change lanes in an emergency. If the braking distance is not enough, collision avoidance can be taken. Ego-car should turn on the turn signal and observe the rear vehicles, and change lanes quickly.

events.justification: When turning, the truck should reduce the speed first, and then increase the turning radius of the vehicle to turn. Do not turn the steering wheel violently, especially for heavy vehicles, which are prone to sideslip.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle  goes straight crossing paths at non-signalized junctions; vehicles drive too fast with short braking distance; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicles should not exceed the speed limit during driving, especially in areas with many pedestrians.Vehicles should slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.description: [CLS]lead vehicle decelerates; The vehicle in front of ego-car decelerates or stops suddenly; [SEP]
events.justification: When the ego-car driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front vehicle, he should quickly decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the front vehicle.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle  goes straight crossing paths at non-signalized junctions; vehicles run red light; [SEP]
events.justification: The vehicle drivers should strictly abide by the traffic rules during driving. When the red light is on, he/she shall brake in time. When he/she encounters a zebra crossing or stop line during driving, he/she must pay attention to the traffic lights.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns on a road with the same direction to another vehicle; vehicles do not give way to normal driving vehicles when turning or changing lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: Before turning or changing lanes, vehicles should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles and control the speed. When driving, vehicles should abide by traffic rules, and give the way for the normal running vehicles. Vehicles that will enter the main road should give way to the vehicles which drive on the main road or leave the main road. Vehicles that drive on the auxiliary road should give way to the vehicles which drive off the main road.

events.description: [CLS]vehicles meet on the road; the truck is out of control; [SEP]
events.justification: The truck should not drive too fast in bad weather, such as rainy, snowy, nightyime, or in poor locations, such as mountain areas and curves. At the same time, the drivers should keep calm, control the vehicle, and slow down with quick braking. Do not step on the brakes.

events.description: [CLS]lead vehicle stops; Ego-car drives too fast and the braking distance is short; [SEP]
events.justification: Ego-cars should not exceed the speed limit during driving, slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, especially for areas with many pedestrians.

events.description: [CLS]a pedestrian crosses the road; Pedestrian does not notice the coming vehicles when crossing the street.; [SEP]
events.justification: When passing the zebra crossing, drivers must slow down. When pedestrians or non-motor vehicles cross the zebra crossing, they should stop and give way to other normal running vehicles; When crossing the road, pedestrians must follow the zebra crossing, carefully observe the traffic, and do not cross the road in a hurry.

events.description: a vehicle turns left across path at signalized junctions; Ego-car drives too fast and the braking distance is short
events.justification: Ego-cars should not exceed the speed limit during driving, slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, especially for areas with many pedestrians.

events.description: [CLS]a following vehicle makes a maneuver; The truck ahead decelerates or stops suddenly; [SEP]
events.justification: When the truck driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front car, it should follow the deceleration quickly and observe the road conditions. The truck driver should put his foot on the brake pedal and be ready to step on the brake at any time. A sufficient safety distance should be left from the car in front.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns left across path at non-signalized junctions; vehicles do not notice the coming trucks when turning or changling lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: When the vehicles changing lanes or turning, they should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles, control the speed and ensure a safe distance.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle  goes straight at signalized junctions; vehicles run red light; [SEP]
events.justification: The vehicle drivers should strictly abide by the traffic rules during driving. When the red light is on, he/she shall brake in time. When he/she encounters a zebra crossing or stop line during driving, he/she must pay attention to the traffic lights.

events.justification: Vehicles should not drive too fast in bad weather and severe road types, such as rainy, snowy, nightyime, or in poor locations, and mountain areas and curves. At the same time, vehicle drivers should keep calm, control the vehicle, and slow down with quick braking. Do not step on the brakes.

When driving, vehicles should abide by traffic rules, and give the way for the normal running vehicles. Vehicles that will enter the main road should give way to the vehicles which drive on the main road or leave the main road. Vehicles that drive on the auxiliary road should give way to the vehicles which drive off the main road.

events.justification: Before turning or changing lanes, vehicles should turn on the turn signal in advance, observe the surrounding vehicles and control the speed. When driving, vehicles should abide by traffic rules, and give the way for the normal running vehicles. Vehicles that will enter the main road should give way to the vehicles which drive on the main road or leave the main road. Vehicles that drive on the auxiliary road should give way to the vehicles which drive off the main road.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle controls loss; The truck drives too fast in rainy and snowy day; [SEP]
events.justification: The truck should keep enough distance from the surrounding vehicles when driving. When braking, the truck should slow down with quick braking, and do not step on the brake.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle controls loss; the truck does not notice the coming vehicles when turning or changling lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: If the trucks turn on the turn signal in advance when turning or turning, they should pay attention to the speed limit, and give way to the straightly moving vehicles.

events.description: there is an object crash; Ego-car hits the object falling from the front vehicles
events.justification: Before driving, ego-car must be carefully checked, and the articles carried on the vehicle must be bundled. During driving, the goods must also be observed at any time. If there is looseness, inclination and other conditions, they should be timely re wrapped and bundled; During driving, the self-propelled vehicle should keep a certain safe distance from other vehicles, especially for the large trucks carrying goods, and should not follow or parallel with them for a long time.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle changes lanes with the same direction to ego-car/another vehicle; Ego-car does not notice the vehicle when turning or changing lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: If the ego-cars turn on the turn signal in advance when turning, they should pay attention to the observation and control of the speed, and give way to the straight moving vehicles.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle controls loss; the truck is out of control; [SEP]
events.justification: The truck should not drive too fast in bad weather, such as rainy, snowy, nightyime, or in poor locations, such as mountain areas and curves. At the same time, the drivers should keep calm, control the vehicle, and slow down with quick braking. Do not step on the brakes.

events.justification: Ego-cars should not exceed the speed limit during driving, slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, especially for areas with many pedestrians.

events.description: [CLS]a following vehicle makes a maneuver; The vehicle ahead decelerates or stops suddenly; [SEP]
events.justification: When the front vehicles decelerate or stop suddenly, the driver should quickly follow and decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the vehicle in front.

events.description: [CLS]lead vehicle stops; vehicles drive too fast with short braking distance; [SEP]
events.justification: Vehicles should not exceed the speed limit during driving, especially in areas with many pedestrians.Vehicles should slow down when passing intersections or crosswalks, and observe the traffic carefully.

events.description: [CLS]there is an object crash; The vehicle evades other vehicles, pedestrians or objects and changes lanes emergently; [SEP]
events.justification: The safety distance between the vehicle and the front vehicle should be sufficient for emergency braking. In case of an emergency on the road, the vehicles should stop in the lane and try not to change lanes in an emergency. If the braking distance is not enough, collision avoidance can be taken. The vehicles should turn on the turn signal and observe the rear vehicles and change lanes quickly.

events.description: [CLS]lead vehicle stops; The vehicle in front of ego-car decelerates or stops suddenly; [SEP]
events.justification: When the ego-car driver encounters a sudden deceleration or stop of the front vehicle, he should quickly decelerate, observe the road conditions, place his foot above the brake pedal, be ready to step on the brake at any time, and leave a sufficient safety distance from the front vehicle.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns right across path at signalized junctions; vehicles do not notice the pedestrians when turning or changling lanes; [SEP]
events.justification: The speed of vehicles should not be too fast when changing lanes or turning. They should observe the coming vehicles and pedestrians carefully.

events.description: [CLS]a vehicle turns left across path at non-signalized junctions; vehicles's vision are blocked and there is no time to brake; [SEP]
events.justification: When the vehicle stops at the intersection or trunk road where the vision is blocked, the vehicle should slow down or whistle to prevent other vehicles or pedestrians from rushing out suddenly.
